title: Europe Today: EU–India summit begins, will it end with a trade deal?
content: Tune in to Euronews' new flagship morning programme, Europe Today, at 8 am Brussels time. In just 15 minutes, we bring you up to speed on the biggest news of the day.

title: Newsletter: EU aims to ‘hedge’ against global instability with India trade deal
content: Also in this newsletter: EU lawmakers to decide whether to resume work on the implementation of the EU-US deal later today.

title: Exclusive: Trade Commissioner says ‘mother of all deals’ will open India market for EU companies
content: The European Union is pushing to open India’s economy to European companies as Brussels moves into the final stretch of negotiations on a long-awaited free-trade agreement with New Delhi, EU trade chief Maroš Šefčovič told Euronews.

title: Watch the video: Is the EU building a European army?
content: What if the EU assembled a European army? Well, the reality is... it probably won't. But we are forging something else.

title: 'Ukraine will be part of the discussion this week in India,' says Irish EU affairs minister
content: Thomas Byrne told Euronews' Europe Today morning show that "it's very, very important that we can put in place a trade agreement with India".

title: EU and AI: Is it a lost battle? Take our poll
content: Can the EU still catch up in the global race for artificial intelligence? And how far should the EU go to catch up? Take our poll and share your view.

title: Europe's forests: Where are they growing fastest?
content: Portugal's forests are growing faster than those of any other country, but this surge comes at a massive environmental cost. How is the country trying to reverse course?

title: Sabotage and misplaced funds: Misleading claims spread over Spain's train crashes
content: False online theories have filled an information gap as investigators work to discover what caused back-to-back deadly train collisions.

title: Commission approves eight more SAFE defence investment plans worth €74bn
content: SAFE is one of the biggest prongs of the EU's Readiness 2030 package, which aims to inject hundreds of billions of euros into defence before the end of the decade – by which time many intelligence agencies estimate Russia could attack another European country.

title: Rutte defies MEPs and praises Trump as 'very important' to NATO
content: The NATO Secretary General credited US President Donald Trump with pushing European allies to spend more money on defence.

title: EU energy ministers pledge to boost offshore wind power in North Sea
content: Nine European governments have agreed to expand offshore wind capacity across the North Sea to up to 100 GW by facilitating key cross-border projects. Ministers said the completion of these ambitions will cut electricity costs by 30% by 2040.

title: EU plans investment conference in Jordan in April
content: Commission President Ursula von der Leyen will visit Amman as the EU attempts to use economic diplomacy to foster prosperity in stable areas of the Middle East.

title: Greenlandic minister says US interests unclear with ‘no deal’ yet on the table
content: Minister Naaja Nathanielsen told Euronews that the Greenlandic government is seeking clarity on the Trump administration’s demands, cautioning that ‘full access’ to her Arctic country’s mineral resources would cross its red lines.

title: After bruising Greenland crisis, Europe shifts focus back to Ukraine
content: Ukraine is back at the top of the European agenda after Donald Trump's latest tariff threats briefly upended collective efforts towards peace.

title: World Economic Forum in Davos reflects global tensions, Harvard professor says
content: The World Economic Forum in Davos, which ended on Friday, once again revealed the profound international geopolitical transformations currently under way.

title: Italy recalls Swiss ambassador after Crans-Montana bar fire suspect is released
content: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni condemned the release of the co-owner of a Swiss bar where a fire on New Year's Day killed 40 people, six of whom were Italian citizens.

title: Green electricity: Which EU countries are using the most?
content: Total use from renewable sources across the EU has nearly reached 50%, driven by hydro and, increasingly, by solar.

title: How Europeans closed ranks to defend Greenland against Trump
content: Donald Trump's shock threat to impose tariffs to seize Greenland prompted a frantic race against the clock to avert the collapse of the transatlantic alliance. Here's how Europeans came together to save it.

title: 'Electrifying everything' is key to Europe's future, IEA chief tells Euronews at Davos
content: The International Energy Agency (IEA) chief told Euronews that safeguarding the continent's energy security and reaching climate goals will be dependent on electrifying "everything" — from energy infrastructure, to transport and buildings.

title: EPP penalises Hungarian opposition party Tisza for not supporting von der Leyen
content: MEPs from Hungary's main opposition party did not show up to defend their political ally, Ursula von der Leyen, at a motion of censure vote on Thursday – but party leader Péter Magyar said the ensuing sanctions from the EPP Group show they don't have "owners" in Brussels.

title: Watch the video: Ryanair vs Musk — who's on board?
content: "Come fly with me, let's fly away": Michael O’Leary and Elon Musk have been embroiled in a major argument that began on Musk's platform X and extended to O'Leary's Ryanair. The reason for this sudden show of affection? A fight over Musk’s Starlink WiFi onboard.

title: Clean steel in the making: inside Europe's future green metallurgical plants
content: This is the story of how a small European Union family business has grown to become a global game changer in the ultracompetitive sector of clean steel. A technological challenge… made in Europe.

title: Which European countries will heatwaves hit hardest by 2100?
content: As heatwave records are broken each year in Europe, countries across the continent are being hit particularly hard by climate change. However, Mediterranean countries aren't topping the list as expected.

title: Exclusive: Mitsotakis tells Euronews 'most' European countries can’t join Trump’s 'Board of Peace'
content: In an interview on Euronews’ morning show Europe Today, Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis rebuked US President Donald Trump’s “Board of Peace” initiative. He also expressed relief at the de-escalation of tensions with the US over Greenland.

title: Merz heads to Italy for summit with Meloni with new ideas to shake up EU bureaucracy
content: A closer alliance between Meloni and Merz is on the horizon, with the ambition to change Europe after decades of dominance by the Franco-German axis.

title: Podcast: From Davos handshakes to Brussels emergency Talks: What’s Next for the EU?
content: Donald Trump dropped his threat of imposing tariffs on some European countries, but should the EU let its guard down?

title: Newsletter: With US ties bruised, EU leaders get 'their act together'
content: Also in this newsletter: the EU raises 'serious concerns' about Donald Trump's Board of Peace.

title: Europe Today: Greek PM joins to debrief on emergency EU Summit
content: Tune in to Euronews' new flagship morning programme, Europe Today, at 8 am Brussels time. In just 15 minutes, we bring you up to speed on the biggest news of the day.

title: EU leaders demand respect from Trump after Greenland crisis rattles relationship
content: The battered state of EU-US relations took centre stage at an extraordinary summit of leaders in Brussels, who demanded respect from Donald Trump.

title: Watch: Is this year's Davos just the Donald Trump Show?
content: US President Donald Trump is now accompanied by a record-breaking delegation: five cabinet secretaries, senior advisers and additional staff, constituting the largest American contingent in the event’s history.

title: EU must 'move towards creating European army', Spanish FM tells Euronews
content: Spain’s foreign minister told Euronews that Europe must take full control of its own security in the face of rising geopolitical uncertainties. To this end, he said the EU must move towards creating a European army.

title: NATO allies unaware of Greenland deal details so far, says Spanish FM Albares
content: A security framework for Greenland negotiated by NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte will have to be presented before all allies for consideration, the Spanish Foreign Minister told Euronews on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum in Davos on Thursday.

title: NATO military planners 'waiting for direction' on Greenland framework deal
content: Little has yet filtered out about the deal, although it has apparently satisfied Donald Trump enough for him to withdraw his tariff threat against eight European countries.

title: Where are the best and worst places to hire in Europe in 2026?
content: Denmark, Switzerland and Ireland set the pace as some of the most attractive places to hire in Europe, thanks to strong skill ecosystems, high productivity, and trusted institutions.

title: European Parliament backs von der Leyen despite clash over Mercosur deal
content: A vote of no confidence tabled against Ursula von der Leyen by far-right group Patriots for Europe was defeated in the European Parliament by a large majority.

title: Europe mulls over an uneasy truce with the US over Greenland
content: Europe is taking stock after several days of US sabre-rattling which risked the end of transatlantic relations, and potentially the end of NATO. While the threat of a takeover of Greenland seems to be over, trust among the US's allies has been badly eroded – perhaps permanently.

title: The EU will defend itself 'against any form of coercion', Costa says
content: EU leaders gathered in Brussels to discuss relations with the US after a diplomatic roller-coaster of a week that saw Donald Trump threaten, then withdraw, plans to impose additional tariffs on European nations to force the sale of Greenland.

title: Newsletter: Trump steps back from the precipice
content: Also in today's newsletter: EU enlargement chief Marta Kos speaks about plans for post-war Ukraine's economic recovery, and why the implementation of the EU-Mercosur trade deal risks being kicked down the road.

title: EU enlargement chief hails progress with US on post-war economic plan for Ukraine
content: European Commissioner for Enlargement Marta Kos spoke with Euronews on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum in Davos about Ukraine's reconstruction and path to EU membership.

title: Ex-Commission president Juncker says 'the EU is not a slave of the United States'
content: Jean-Claude Juncker, who led the European Commission during the first Trump administration, told Euronews that the EU "cannot be submitted to the neo-colonial behaviour" of the United States.

title: Europe’s largest rare earths mine: How EU funding clashes with environmental laws
content: The European Union is pouring financial resources into Europe’s largest known rare-earth project to reduce its dependence on China for critical raw materials. But how does the same EU legal framework threaten to halt this strategic push?

title: Europe Today: EU leaders meet in Brussels to discuss Davos, Trump, and Greenland
content: Tune in to Euronews' new flagship morning programme, Europe Today, at 8 am Brussels time. In just 15 minutes, we bring you up to speed on the biggest news of the day.

title: Peace between Armenia and Azerbaijan is 'changing Eurasia', regional leaders say
content: The Armenian and Azerbaijani presidents came together for the first time since signing a historic peace deal. Regional stakeholders celebrated how peace will shape the future for the whole region.

title: Greenland, NATO and war: Fact-checking Trump’s Davos speech
content: Addressing the World Economic Forum, US President Donald Trump attacked Europe’s energy policies and alleged the US “returned” Greenland to Denmark following World War Two. The Cube looks at where facts back his claims.

title: Fact check: What is Trump's 'Board of Peace' and would it have real power?
content: A leaked charter suggests Trump's "Board of Peace" aims to have a worldwide mandate. International law experts say its power would be limited.

title: MEPs back three-hour deadline for delayed flight compensation and free hand luggage
content: Members of the European Parliament have backed a text to enhance passenger rights after more than a decade's wait. With some airlines arguing it could put them out of business, the decision now needs to be endorsed by EU countries.

title: Trump in Davos: 'What I'm asking for is a piece of ice'
content: US President Trump says that all he is asking for is "a piece of ice, cold and poorly located, that can play a vital role in world peace," referring to Greenland, during an address to the World Economic Forum.

title: Watch: What is Trump's Board of Peace about?
content: Do you have a gym membership or a loyalty card in your wallet? Well, the US president just launched the ultimate club. It’s called the "Board of Peace." The official goal? To end the Israel-Hamas war in Gaza. But is it really?

title: EU lawmakers freeze EU-US trade deal after Trump tariff threat
content: The move will intensify tensions between Brussels and Washington ahead of a summit where EU leaders are set to weigh their response to Trump's escalating threats.

title: European leaders take the floor in Davos - All you need to know about day one
content: Our correspondents on the ground bring you all the highlights from the heart of the World Economic Forum in Davos.

title: European Parliament freezes Mercosur deal, referring it to EU Court of Justice
content: After clearing major political hurdles after more than two decades, the mammoth trade deal now faces further delay pending a judicial verdict.

title: Housing crisis: Who's most affected by Europe's lack of affordable housing?
content: A decade of soaring house prices and rents across the EU is straining household budgets, deepening overcrowding and reshaping living and career choices.

title: Fact check: Are Romanians protesting against an 'anti–free speech' law?
content: Thousands of people took to the streets of Bucharest last week to protest against a law that they say threatens freedom of expression in Romania. However, an investigation by The Cube suggests that the legislation is intended to combat extremist activity.

title: EU leaders face 'critical' moment at Thursday’s summit amid Trump's threats, Calviño says
content: The EU Summit on Thursday will be a critical meeting where leaders must demonstrate Europe’s 'superpower' ability to push back against Donald Trump, EIB President Nadia Calviño told Euronews.

title: US Treasury Secretary asks Europe to “sit down and wait” for Trump in Davos
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on Wednesday decried Europe’s “anger” and “bitterness” over Trump’s tariff threat. Speaking in Davos, Bessent said he believes Europeans will be persuaded to support Trump’s concerns about Greenland once they hear his argument.

title: Invitation to Trump’s Board of Peace complicates EU bid to defuse transatlantic tensions
content: EU leaders will discuss Trump's controversial Gaza Board of Peace when they gather for emergency talks on Greenland on Thursday, with some warning that the board's 'charter' reads as an effort to supplant the United Nations.

title: 'It will be difficult for Spaniards to overcome this trauma,' train crash survivor tells Euronews
content: Javier Garcia, a nurse, was aboard one of the two trains that tragically crashed on Sunday, killing at least 43 people and causing trauma in a country where train travel is a symbol of mobility. He shared his experience with Euronews.

title: Trump says US takeover of Greenland would be 'good' for Europe and NATO
content: Donald Trump urged Europeans to promptly negotiate a sale of Greenland to the United States during an hour-long speech in Davos. The Danish foreign minister said Trump's ambitions remained "intact".

title: Newsletter: Trump flies to Davos with Europe-US relations in the balance
content: Also in this newsletter: why Trump's Gaza Board of Peace is complicating efforts to defuse Greenland tensions, and the view from Strasbourg ahead of a vote that could kick the ratification of the EU-Mercosur deal down the road.

title: Why has Greenland become so important that everyone wants it?
content: Tensions have escalated between the US and Europe as Donald Trump ratchets up efforts to acquire Greenland. Its wealth in rare earths and other minerals makes it highly attractive. Watch the video.

title: Europe Today: Trump dominates Davos amid fears over Greenland and tariffs
content: Tune in to Euronews' new flagship morning programme, Europe Today, at 8 am Brussels time. In just 15 minutes, we bring you up to speed on the biggest news of the day.

title: Why the EU is wary of targeting US services in a trade clash
content: As Washington renews tariff threats, Europe is weighing retaliation. Hitting US services would hurt the US the most, but it comes with high risks.

title: 'President Trump is trying to replace the UN', says Belgian FM
content: US President Donald Trump is trying to supplant the United Nations with his supposedly transitional "Board of Peace", Maxime Prévot told Euronews.

title: Azerbaijan's president says world order transitioning from rule of law to 'rule of strength'
content: At the World Economic Forum in Davos, Ilham Aliyev told Euronews that international relations are "entering a new era".

title: Has Greenland banned Donald Trump and his descendants?
content: A post claiming that Greenland has banned Trump and the next 100 generations of his descendants has racked up millions of views and thousands of shares. But ultimately, it was published by a satirical news channel.
